greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: List the least common multiples of {1, 2, ..., k} for k = 0, 1, ...; this sequence gives the length of the n-th block of consecutive equal numbers.
comment: a(n) is the count of how many consecutive terms in A003418 are equal.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: {2}~Join~Rest@ Most@ Map[Length, Split@ Table[LCM @@ Range@ n, {n, 396}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 18 2016 *)
program: (PARI) do(lim)=my(v=List()); for(e=2,logint(lim\=1,2), forprime(p=2,sqrtnint(lim,e), listput(v,p^e))); v=Set(concat(Vec(v), primes([2,lim]))); concat(2, vector(#v-1,i,v[i+1]-v[i])) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 18 2016
xref: Frequency of given numbers using A003418.
Apart from the first term, same as A057820.
results.author: _Tyler Skywalker_, Jul 18 2016
